params.text:
• Identify problems
  • Use strategies to get around problems
  • Be polite

Telephone

Deal with difficulties

Language in Action
Telephone: Introduction

Problems happen on the phone!

Learn how to manage common telephone challenges.

1. Identify Problems: Recognize different types of problems that can occur during a phone call.

  2. Use strategies to get around problems: Discover helpful techniques to overcome difficulties.

  3. Be polite: Practice polite language for handling problems.
Identify Problems: Flashcards

dialogs.answer: Use this when you can't understand the other person.
Use this when the phone connection is poor.
Use this when the other person's voice is interrupted.
Use this when you don't understand what the other person is saying.
Use this when there is a pause in the conversation.
Use this when you can't hear the other person.

params.textField:
Can you speak *louder*? I can't hear you.
I can't hear you. It's very *noisy* here.
The line is *bad*. I can't hear you clearly.
There's a delay. Can you wait a *moment*?
I don't understand. Can you *explain* it again?
You're breaking up. Can you call me *back*?

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What is the problem with the phone call?
answers:
The phone line has a problem.

Micah is speaking too loudly.

Abigail's phone is broken.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Micah say about the phone connection?
answers:
The line is bad.

She can hear Abigail clearly.

The line is good.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What does Abigail suggest at the end of the conversation?
answers:
They call back later.

They continue the conversation.

They meet in person.

params.text: Identify Problems: Listening & Quiz
Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Micah: Hi Abigail, it's Micah.

Abigail: Hi Micah, how are you?

Micah: I'm good, thanks. How about you?

Abigail: Not bad, thanks. I can't hear you very well. The line is bad.

Micah: Really? Me too! You're breaking up.

Abigail: I know. Let me try calling you back.
Dialogue Text:
Abigail:
Micah:

I'll call you back *later*.

params.text: Use Strategies To Get Around Problems: Forum & Quiz
Please read the following forum posts and answer the questions:

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does Abigail do when she can't hear the other person?
answers:
She asks them to speak louder or slower.

She hangs up the phone.

She ignores the problem.

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: What does Micah do when the line is bad?
answers:
She asks the other person to call back later.

She continues talking.

She gets angry.

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What does Bryan do when he doesn't understand?
answers:
He asks the other person to explain again.

He pretends to understand.

He ends the call.

metadata.title: Use Strategies To Get Around Problems Forum Quiz

params.text: Abigail:
Micah:
Bryan:
If I can't hear someone, I ask them to speak louder or slower. Sometimes I ask them to repeat what they said.
When the line is bad, I try to stay calm. I ask the other person to call back or I call them back later.
If I don't understand, I ask the person to explain it again using different words. Sometimes, I ask them to write it down.
Be Polite: Flashcards

dialogs.answer: Use this word to be polite.
Use this when someone says "thank you".
Use this to greet someone politely.

params.textField:
*Excuse* me, can you repeat that?
You're *welcome*
Please *wait* a moment..
Good morning, how can I *help* you?
Thank you *for* your help.
*Sorry*, I can't hear you.

params.text: Be Polite: Sentences
Be Polite:  Listening & Quiz

choices.question: Question 1 of 3: What does Bryan want to do?
answers:
Talk to Mr. Hamilton

Talk to the receptionist

Leave a message

choices.question: Question 2 of 3: How does Bryan make his request?
answers:
He is polite

He shouts at the receptionist

He hangs up the phone

choices.question: Question 3 of 3: What does the receptionist say after Bryan makes his request?
answers:
She puts Bryan on hold

She says goodbye

She says Mr. Hamilton is not available

params.text: Please listen to the following conversation and answer the questions below:

params.audioNotSupported: Your browser does not support this audio

params.text:
Receptionist: Good morning. Hartford Trading. How can I help you?

Bryan: Good morning. Could I speak to Mr. Hamilton, please?

Receptionist: Certainly, sir. Please hold.

Bryan: Thank you.
Dialogue Text:
Bryan:
Receptionist:
Module Summary Quiz
Test your instruction-following skills! Choose the BEST answer for each question to show what you learned in this module.

choices.question: Question 1 of 6: What should you do if you can't hear the other person clearly?
answers:
Ask them to speak louder or slower.

Hang up the phone.

Ignore the problem.

choices.question: Question 2 of 6: How can you politely interrupt someone on the phone?
answers:
Use the phrase "Excuse me".

Shout at them.

Hang up the phone.

choices.question: Question 3 of 6: What should you do if the phone line is bad?
answers:
Try to call back later.

Continue talking.

End the call immediately.

choices.question: Question 4 of 6: Which phrase can you use to ask for repetition?
answers:
Could you repeat that, please?

Please speak louder.

I don't like your voice.

choices.question: Question 5 of 6: How can you show gratitude on the phone?
answers:
Say "thank you".

Hang up quickly.

Ignore the other person.

choices.question: Question 6 of 6: What should you do if you don't understand what the other person is saying?
answers:
Ask them to explain it again.

Pretend to understand.

End the call.
